attributes.text:
The Core module’s responsibility is to query the DOM for elements and offer these elements as a collection. The Core module itself does not offer any methods to work with the collection. These methods are added by the other included modules, such as Manipulating or Attributes.

Core also provides the plugin API which allows modules to attach either static functions to the global q object or define methods on the collection it returns.

For further details, take a look at the documentation in the user manual.
A map containing the methods to attach.
This is an API for module development and can be used to attach new methods to {@link q}.
This is an API for module development and can be used to attach new initialization methods to {@link q} which will be called when a new collection is created.
A map containing the methods to attach.
This is an API for module development and can be used to attach new methods to {@link q}.
An Element or an array of Elements which will be initialized as {@link q}.
Name of the class. If null, the class will not be attached to a namespace.
Define a new class using the qooxdoo class system.
Convert the first character of the string to upper case.
the string with an upper case first character
Returns the owner document of the given node
The document of the given DOM node
Checks if the given object is a DOM node
true if the object is a DOM node

Converts a hyphenated string (separated by ’-’) to camel case.

Example:

q.string.camelCase("I-like-cookies"); //returns "ILikeCookies"

The implementation does not force a lowerCamelCase or upperCamelCase version. The first letter of the parameter keeps its case.
Expires directive value in days starting from now, or null if the cookie should be deleted when the browser is closed.
Sets the string value of a cookie.
Executes the given function once the document is ready.
Convert an arguments object into an array.
a newly created array (copy) with the content of the arguments object.
Check whether the string starts with the given substring.
whether the string starts with the given substring
Get the value stored for the given key.
The value stored for the given key.
Returns the DOM2 defaultView (window) for the given node.
Get the internal class of the value. The following classes are possible: “String”, “Array”, “Object”, “RegExp”, “Number”, “Boolean”, “Date”, “Function”, “Error”
The object holding the data to render.
Original and only template method of mustache.js. For further documentation, please visit https://github.com/janl/mustache.js
Hook function to be called on event registration
Hook function to be called on event deregistration
Registers an event hook for the given event types.
Check whether the string ends with the given substring.
whether the string ends with the given substring
Convert the first character of the string to lower case.
the string with a lower case first character
Checks if the given object is a DOM document object
true if the object is a DOM document
The key for the saved string value.
Returns the string value of a cookie.
Returns the saved string value if the cookie contains a value for the key, otherwise null
Creates a new collection from the given argument. This can either be an HTML string, a single DOM element or an array of elements
Unregisters a normalization function from the given event types.
Checks if the given object is a DOM element
true if the object is a DOM element
Check whether the two arrays have the same content. Checks only the equality of the arrays’ content.
element to be removed from the array
the string where to escape the chars.
Escapes all chars that have a special meaning in regular expressions.
Deletes the string value of a cookie.
Returns the highest value in the given array. Supports numeric values only.
The highest of all values or undefined if array is empty.
Mandatory URL to load the data from.
Returns a predefined script tag wrapper which can be used to load data from cross-domain origins.
the elements of this array will be excluded from the other one
Modifies the first array as it removes all elements which are listed in the second array as well.
The id of the HTML template in the DOM.
The object holding the data to render.

Helper method which provides direct access to templates stored as HTML in the DOM. The DOM node with the given ID will be treated as a template, parsed and a new DOM node will be returned containing the parsed data. Keep in mind that templates can only have one root element.
Collection containing a single DOM element with the parsed template data.
List of event types to be normalized. Use an asterisk (*) to normalize all event types

Registers a normalization function for the given event types. Listener callbacks for these types will be called with the return value of the normalization function instead of the regular event object.

The normalizer will be called with two arguments: The original event object and the element on which the event was triggered

Converts an array like object to any other array like object.

Attention: The returned array may be same instance as the incoming one if the constructor is identical!

Converts a camelcased string to a hyphenated (separated by ’-’) string.

Example:

q.string.hyphenate("ILikeCookies"); //returns "I-like-cookies"

The implementation does not force a lowerCamelCase or upperCamelCase version. The first letter of the parameter keeps its case.
Recreates an array which is free of all duplicate elements from the original. This method do not modifies the original array! Keep in mind that this methods deletes undefined indexes.
Returns a copy with no duplicates or the original array if no duplicates were found.
Mandatory URL to load the data from.

Optional settings map which may contain one of the following settings:

  • method The method of the request. Default: 
GET
  • async flag to mark the request as asynchronous. Default: 
true
  • header A map of request headers.
Returns a configured XMLHttpRequest object. Using the send method will finally send the request.
The key to store the value for.
Adds a new environment setting which can be queried via {@link #get}.
Insert an element into the array before a given second element.
Returns the lowest value in the given array. Supports numeric values only.
The lowest of all values or undefined if array is empty.
Insert an element into the array after a given second element.
Mandatory URL to load the data from.

Optional settings map which may contain one of the following settings:

  • callbackName: The name of the callback which will
    be called by the loaded script.
  • callbackParam: The name of the callback expected by the server
Returns a predefined script tag wrapper which can be used to load data from cross-domain origins via JSONP.
Hook function to be called on event registration
Hook function to be called on event deregistration
Unregisters a hook from the given event types.
Valid selector (CSS3 + extensions) or DOM element or Array of DOM Elements.
Only the children of this element are considered.

Accepts a selector string and returns a set of found items. The optional context element can be used to reduce the amount of found elements to children of the context element.

Sizzle is used as selector engine. Check out the documentation for more details.
Gets a new collection containing the offset parent of each item in the current set.
CSS position values like 50% 50% or left top.
Name of the style property to modify
Modifies the given style property on all elements in the collection.

Gets a set of elements containing all of the unique immediate children of each of the matched set of elements. This set can be filtered with an optional expression that will cause only elements matching the selector to be collected.
Removes the blockers from all items in the collection

Returns the backface-visibility property of the first element.

Spec: http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-3d-transforms/#backface-visibility-property
Selector expression to match the child elements against
Searches the child elements of each item in the collection and returns a new collection containing the children that match the provided selector
New collection containing the matching child elements
Inserts content before each element in the collection. This can either be an HTML string, an array of HTML strings, a single DOM element or an array of elements.
Manipulates the play state of the animation. This can be used to pause an animation when running.
Gets a collection containing the preceding sibling elements of each item in the current set (ignoring text and comment nodes) up to but not including any element that matches the given selector.

Gets a set containing the closest matching ancestor for each item in the collection. If the item itself matches, it is added to the new set. Otherwise, the item’s parent chain will be traversed until a match is found.
New collection containing the closest matching ancestors
Returns the content height of the first element in the collection. This is the maximum height the element can use, excluding borders, margins, padding or scroll bars.
Returns the values of multiple style properties for each item in the collection
Replaces a class name on each element in the collection
DOM element to add to the collection
Returns an array from a selector expression or a single element

Gets a set of elements containing all ancestors of each element in the collection. This set can be filtered with an optional expression that will cause only elements matching the selector to be collected.
Gets a collection containing only the elements that have descendants matching the given selector
a new collection containing only elements with matching descendants
Adds a class name to each element in the collection
Fades out all elements in the collection.
Removes a class name from each element in the collection
Returns the left scroll position of the first element in the collection.
Focuses the first element in the collection
Executes the provided callback function once for each item in the collection.
Remove elements from the collection that do not pass the given filter. This can be either a selector expression or a filter function
Gets a collection containing the following sibling elements of each item in the current set (ignoring text and comment nodes) up to but not including any element that matches the given selector.
Sets multiple attributes for each item in the collection.
The duration in milliseconds of the animation, which will override the duration given in the description.
Starts an animation in reversed order. For further details, take a look at the {@link #animate} method.
Removes each element in the current collection from the DOM

Returns the perspective property of the first element.

Spec: http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-3d-transforms/#perspective-property
Returns the values of multiple attributes for the first item in the collection

Gets a collection containing the previous sibling element of each item in the current set (ignoring text and comment nodes). This set can be filtered with an optional expression that will cause only elements matching the selector to be collected.
Adds multiple class names to each element in the collection
Returns the content width of the first element in the collection. This is the maximum width the element can use, excluding borders, margins, padding or scroll bars.
Returns the class name of the first element in the collection
Sets the HTML content of each item in the collection
The duration in milliseconds of the animation, which will override the duration given in the description.

Starts the animation with the given description. The description should be a map, which could look like this:

{
  "duration": 1000,
  "keep": 100,
  "keyFrames": {
    0 : {"opacity": 1, "scale": 1},
    100 : {"opacity": 0, "scale": 0}
  },
  "origin": "50% 50%",
  "repeat": 1,
  "timing": "ease-out",
  "alternate": false,
  "reverse": false
}

duration is the time in milliseconds one animation cycle should take.

keep is the key frame to apply at the end of the animation. (optional)

keyFrames is a map of separate frames. Each frame is defined by a number which is the percentage value of time in the animation. The value is a map itself which holds css properties or transforms (Transforms only for CSS Animations).

origin maps to the transform origin {@link qx.bom.element.Transform#setOrigin} (Only for CSS animations).

repeat is the amount of time the animation should be run in sequence. You can also use “infinite”.

timing takes one of these predefined values: ease | linear | ease-in | ease-out | ease-in-out | cubic-bezier(<number>, <number>, <number>, <number>) (cubic-bezier only available for CSS animations)

alternate defines if every other animation should be run in reverse order.
The position of the element in the collection
Reduce the set of matched elements to a single element.
HTML string or DOM element(s) to append
Appends content to each element in the current set. Accepts an HTML string, a single DOM element or an array of elements
Gets a new set of elements containing the child nodes of each item in the current set.
Returns a copy of the collection within the given range.
A new collection containing a slice of the original collection.
true if the backface should be visible.

Applies the given value to each element in the collection. Normally the value is given as a string/number value and applied to the field content (textfield, textarea) or used to detect whether the field is checked (checkbox, radiobutton). Supports array values for selectboxes (multiple selection) and checkboxes or radiobuttons (for convenience). Please note: To modify the value attribute of a checkbox or radiobutton use

Gets a collection containing all sibling elements of the items in the current set. This set can be filtered with an optional expression that will cause only elements matching the selector to be collected.
Toggles the given list of class names on each item in the collection
Returns whether an animation is running or not.
Type of the event to listen for
Context the callback function will be executed in. Default: The element on which the listener was registered
Registers a listener for the given event type on each item in the collection. This can be either native or custom events.
Gets a new collection containing only those elements that passed the given filter. This can be either a selector expression or a filter function.
New collection containing the elements that passed the filter
Returns the value of the given style property for the first item in the collection.
The color for the blocker element (any CSS color value)
The CSS opacity value for the blocker
Adds an overlay to all items in the collection that intercepts mouse events.
The perspective layer. Numbers between 100 and 5000 give the best results.
Removes the given attribute from all elements in the collection
Returns the value of the given attribute for the first item in the collection.
Checks if one or more listeners for the given event type are attached to the first element in the collection
true if one or more listeners are attached
Returns the rendered width of the first element in the collection
Selector expression, HTML string, DOM element or list of DOM elements
Wraps each element in the collection in a copy of an HTML structure. Elements will be appended to the deepest nested element in the structure as determined by a depth-first search.
Skews by the given value. For further details, take a look at the {@link #transform} method.
The map containing the transforms and value.

Method to apply multiple transforms at once to the given element. It takes a map containing the transforms you want to apply plus the values e.g.{scale: 2, rotate: “5deg”}. The values can be either singular, which means a single value will be added to the CSS. If you give an array, the values will be split up and each array entry will be used for the X, Y or Z dimension in that order e.g. {scale: [2, 0.5]} will result in a element double the size in X direction and half the size in Y direction. Make sure your browser supports all transformations you apply.

Returns the transform-style property of the first element.

Spec: http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-3d-transforms/#transform-style-property
Toggles the given class name on each item in the collection
Inserts the current collection after each target item. The collection items are moved after the first target. For subsequent targets, clones of the collection items are created and inserted.
Translates by the given value. For further details, take a look at the {@link #transform} method.

Returns the transform-origin property of the first element.

Spec: http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-3d-transforms/#transform-origin-property
The set property, e.g. 50% 50% or null, of the collection is empty.

Gets a set of elements containing the parent of each element in the collection. This set can be filtered with an optional expression that will cause only elements matching the selector to be collected.
Removes all content from the elements in the collection
Selector that indicates where to stop including ancestor elements

Gets a collection containing all preceding sibling elements of each item in the current set (ignoring text and comment nodes). This set can be filtered with an optional expression that will cause only elements matching the selector to be collected.
CSS position values like 50% 50% or left top.
Removes multiple class names from each element in the collection
Scrolls the elements of the collection to the given coordinate.
Sets a property on each item in the collection
Returns the distance between the first element in the collection and its offset parent
a map with the keys left and top containing the distance between the elements
Returns the value of the given property for the first item in the collection
Scrolls the elements of the collection to the given coordinate.
Sets an HTML attribute on each item in the collection

Returns the currently configured value for the first item in the collection. Works with simple input fields as well as with select boxes or option elements. Returns an array for select boxes with multi selection. In all other cases, a string is returned.

Returns the perspective-origin property of the first element.

Spec: http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-3d-transforms/#perspective-origin-property
Name of the qx.dom.Hierarchy method to apply
Optional selector that elements to be included must match

Helper function that iterates over a set of items and applies the given qx.dom.Hierarchy method to each entry, storing the results in a new Array. Duplicates are removed and the items are filtered if a selector is provided.
Returns the values of multiple properties for the first item in the collection
Removes multiple attributes from each item in the collection.
Optional data that will be passed to the listener callback function.
Fire an event of the given type.
Selector that indicates where to stop including ancestor elements

Gets a set of elements containing all ancestors of each element in the collection, up to (but not including) the element matched by the provided selector. This set can be filtered with an optional expression that will cause only elements matching the selector to be collected.

Gets a collection containing the next sibling element of each item in the current set (ignoring text and comment nodes). This set can be filtered with an optional expression that will cause only elements matching the selector to be collected.
Returns the top scroll position of the first element in the collection.
Checks if at least one element in the collection passes the provided filter. This can be either a selector expression or a filter function
true if at least one element matches

Gets a collection containing all following sibling elements of each item in the current set (ignoring text and comment nodes). This set can be filtered with an optional expression that will cause only elements matching the selector to be collected.
Returns the HTML content of the first item in the collection
HTML content or null if the collection is empty
Returns the computed location of the given element in the context of the document dimensions.
A map with the keys left>, top>, right> and bottom> which contains the distance of the element relative to the document.
Returns the rendered height of the first element in the collection.
A map of style property name/value pairs
Sets multiple style properties for each item in the collection.
Parent selector expression or list of parent elements

Appends all items in the collection to the specified parents. If multiple parents are given, the items will be moved to the first parent, while clones of the items will be appended to subsequent parents.
Fades in all elements in the collection.
Sets multiple properties for each item in the collection.
Manipulates the play state of the animation. This can be used to continue an animation when paused.
Reduces the collection to the last element.
Inserts the current collection before each target item. The collection items are moved before the first target. For subsequent targets, clones of the collection items are created and inserted.
Clones the items in the current collection and returns them in a new set. Event listeners can also be cloned.
Inserts content after each element in the collection. This can either be an HTML string, an array of HTML strings, a single DOM element or an array of elements.
Scales by the given value. For further details, take a look at the {@link #transform} method.
Reduces the collection to the first element.
Unregisters event listeners for the given type from each element in the collection.
Checks if the first element in the collection has the given class name
true if the first item has the given class name
Returns whether an animation has ended or not.
Alignment of the object with the target, any of “top-left”, “top-right”, “bottom-left”, “bottom-right”, “left-top”, “left-bottom”, “right-top”, “right-bottom”
Map with the desired offsets between the two elements. Must contain the keys left, top, right and bottom

Horizontal placement mode. Valid values are:

  • direct: place the element directly at the given location.
  • keep-align: if the element is partially outside of the visible area, it is moved to the best fitting ‘edge’ and ‘alignment’ of the target. It is guaranteed the the new position attaches the object to one of the target edges and that it is aligned with a target edge.
  • best-fit: If the element is partially outside of the visible area, it is moved into the view port, ignoring any offset and position values.
Vertical placement mode. Accepts the same values as the ‘modeX’ argument.
Moves the first element in the collection, aligning it with the given target.
Type of the event to listen for
Context the callback function will be executed in. Default: The element on which the listener was registered
Attaches a listener for the given event that will be executed only once.
